article.headline: Mercer takes out The Citadel 74-51
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- Phillip Leonard scored 13 points, grabbed five rebounds and had eight assists to help Mercer beat The Citadel 74-51 on Saturday. Ike Nwamu had a team-high 15 points for Mercer (9-9, 4-1 Southern Conference) and Darious Moten added 13. The Bears started 9-1 in conference play last season on their way to share the league's regular season title. Both teams made at least 50 percent of their shots but Mercer hit 15 of 22 from the free-throw line compared to 1 of 3 for The Citadel. Mercer also forced 12 turnovers and only committed three. Brian White led The Citadel (7-9, 2-3) with 10 points and six rebounds. The Bulldogs ended a 19-game road losing streak on Monday at UNC Greensboro. Mercer's starters combined for 31 first-half points as the Bears held a 40-31 advantage.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
